--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Inn Fang" <innfang@y...> wrote:
> 
> Hi, 
> 
> Thanks a lot for the guides. I managed to read the list of files 
> contains in the ARC. I can read the html file as it is in plain text 
> format but not with other format such as .jpg and .pdf.
> 
> How do I extract the jpg and pdf file?
>
Why?  What happens?  Paste in the commands you are using.

For .pdf, I'd imagine you'd do something like:

% ./bin/arcreader --offset=XXXXX --format=nohead| pdfviewer

Or

% ./bin/arcreader --offset=XXXX --format=nohead > tmp.pdf

... and then open tmp.pdf with your pdfviewer.
 
(1.2 cmdline is slightly different).


> Notice that reading each record is slow. 

Do you mean arcfile rather than record in the above?  Yes, reading an
arcfile can be slow.  Reading a record is usually not too bad.

> Normally users will write 
> java file using arcreader class to get all records in one time, am I 
> right? Any other ways?
> 
Yes. Usually. But tell us more of what you are trying to do.

If you want to get random records from arcs, you'll need to know the
offsets in advance, so yes, you'll need to run through it first to
figure what these all are and keep these off in an 'index' of some form.

> ------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> Besides that, I was just using the basic setting that run the test. 
> Whenever there are file formats other than plain text. Do I need to 
> explicitly specify any setting?
Please expand on your question.  I'm a little unclear on what you're
asking.  Are you referring to the ARCReader or to Heritrix?

Yours,
St.Ack


> 
> 
> Thanks,
> Inn Fang
